Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_load_sample_buffer

The function AIL_load_sample_buffer sets the address and length for one of two buffers associated with a sample handle, and enables double-buffering mode for that sample handle.

void AIL_load_sample_buffer(
  HSAMPLE S,
  U32 buff_num,
  void const * buffer,
  U32 len
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample handle whose buffer address and size is to be set.
buff_num
should be 0 or 1, depending on which buffer is to be configured.
buffer
points to the application's data buffer to be treated as buffer 0 or 1.
len
specifies the size of the buffer in bytes.

Discussion

For a complete discussion of double-buffered audio playback, including the use of the two API functions AIL_sample_buffer_ready and AIL_load_sample_buffer, see the description of the AIL_sample_buffer_ready function.

For higher-level streaming, read the "Digital Audio Streaming Services" chapter.

Example files that use this function: DBTEST.C
